title: Person Convicted of Bank Fraud
summary: Joseph Mason, 47, was convicted on nine counts of bank fraud totalling over £25,000. He appeared at Wolverhampton Magistrates' Court and received a custodial sentence.

title: Celebrity Claims Damaging Allegations Were False
summary: Noel Clarke claims he faced life-altering financial losses after the Guardian published misconduct allegations, which he contests are false and defamatory.

title: Charity Founder Convicted of Theft
summary: Colin Nesbitt, founder of Little Heroes Cancer Trust, was found guilty of stealing £87,000 from the children’s cancer charity he ran.

title: Crypto Fraudster Known as 'The Goddess of Wealth'
summary: Chinese national Qian Zhimin, known as 'the goddess of wealth', was convicted of money laundering after UK police seized over £5bn in crypto.

edge_case_type: Organisation as main subject, person named
title: Builder Convicted Amid Organisational Failures
summary: Mark Killick, described as a 'cowboy builder', was convicted of fraud while the article discusses failures that allowed him to keep operating.

title: Age/Date Confusion in Money Laundering Case
summary: Nicola Rowe, sentenced for laundering timeshare fraud proceeds, had conflicting age and DOB details listed between court and press reporting.

title: Mafia Boss Dies in Prison
summary: Matteo Messina Denaro, the infamous Cosa Nostra boss convicted of murders in the 1990s, died in jail. Coverage notes both his crimes and passing.

title: Scandal Rocks CEO 'King of Good Times'
summary: Vijay Mallya, 'The King of Good Times', faces extradition after authorities pursue charges of loan default and financial fraud.
